newsitem.title: ISRAEL: Israel's Pilat to make offering on London's AIM.
newsitem.headline: Israel's Pilat to make offering on London's AIM.

text.p: Pilat Technologies International Ltd, an Israeli software and human resources management consulting firm, plans to raise up to 3.5 million sterling on London's Alternative Investment Market (AIM) next month.
Pilat chairman Michael Zukerman said on Thursday that the company would raise between 2.65 million and 3.5 million sterling, representing 18-23 percent of the company.
Pilat will issue a prospectus on December 3 and offers must be submitted by December 6. Admission date to AIM is December 10.
Zukerman said the company opted for London because "we went to the market that knows us".
Clients of Pilat's British subsidiary include British Airways, Wellcome, British Telecom and Sky.
"We are known in England. A good part of our earnings are from England. And in Israel there is no (new issues) market," he said.
Other Israeli companies such as plastics parts maker Plasson have faced difficulties raising funds in London in the past few months due to the stalled Middle East peace process.
"We are concerned," Zukerman said but added he hoped its recognition in Britain would overcome doubts.
The company, which derives 75 percent of its pretax profit from abroad, also sells in Hong Kong, Australia, South Africa and Malaysia.
Most of the proceeds from the offering will be used to buy Mardoni Associates Inc., a U.S. maker of software for the human resources market, similar to Pilat's products.
"We want to buy a U.S. company to have an outlet in the U.S. market," Zukerman said.
He said Pilat expects to complete the acquisition by the end of the year, adding there was a price cap on the purchase of $4 million in cash.

Pilat is expected to post a net profit in 1996 of one million sterling, including Mardoni's results, while turnover of the two companies combined should reach 17 million sterling, including 15 million sterling from Pilat.
Zukerman noted that any company issuing shares on the AIM cannot make an offering in North America.
